title: Business Live: Shares in US store chains tumble - BBC News
summary: hotel booking sites to be investigated .
iag pre-tax q3 profits soar 22.5 % to €1.2bn .
rbs profits rise in the third quarter .

documents.title: white house disowns puerto rico grid deal
text: white house disowns puerto rico grid deal
author: Paul Blake
BBC News, Washington

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another week on business live .
we hope you 've enjoyed our coverage over the past five days .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on monday morning .
do join us for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: uk credit ratings unchanged
text: s & p global ratings has affirmed that the long-and short term foreign and local currency sovereign credit ratings on the uk are unchanged .
the outlook remains negative and continues to be `` aa/a-1+ '' .
the same rating also applies to the long- and short-term issuer credit ratings on the bank of england , as well as the boe 's long-term rating .

`` we could revise the outlook to stable if negotiations with the eu move faster and with greater certainty for the uk , and if the new arrangement following its departure from the eu is not significantly detrimental to the uk 's economy , including to its large financial and business services sectors , '' said s & p global .

documents.title: wall street closes up
text: all three key us stock indexes rose on friday , helped by strong third quarter results and profit forecasts .
in particular , the tech-heavy nasdaq surged had it 's best day in almost a year .
the index closed up 6,701.26 , a rise of 144.5 points or 2.2 % , on strong earnings by several tech giants including amazon , intel , microsoft and google parent alphabet .
as for the dow jones , it ended the day at 23,433.33 , up 32.5 points of 0.14 % .
and finally , the s & p 500 ended up 2,581.07 , up 20.7 points or 0.81 % , which was also a finishing record .

documents.title: tax avoidance
text: a bbc investigation has discovered that five offshore pfi companies paid little or no corporation tax during a five-year period despite making profits of nearly £ 2bn .
the five companies specialised in lending money through private finance initiatives ( pfi ) .
pfi : five firms avoid tax despite £ 2bn profits , bbc learns
a great labour cock up
@ twitterid @ twitterid time for hmrc to take a closer interest ?

documents.title: ni could be 'autonomous customs territory '
text: ni could be 'autonomous customs territory '
author: John Campbell
BBC News NI Economics & Business Editor

documents.title: stranger things 2
text: gearing up to watch stranger things 2 ?
in celebration of the new series , snapchat has created a new feature that lets fans of the spooky 1980s netflix drama explore the byers family 's living room in augmented reality .
the world lense filter overlays a `` portal '' to the living room set over the user 's surroundings , letting the user walk around the room by moving their smartphone .
the portal can only be accessed by putting the show on and allowing the shazam music recognition app to up the show 's theme music .

documents.title: blacklist
text: the us government has published a list of 39 companies it believes has ties to russian military and intelligence agencies .
all clients and partners of these russian agencies will face sanctions under a new us law .
the companies named include military arms and vehicle supplier rosoboronexport and firearms pioneer kalashnikov .

documents.title: us markets on the rise
text: the three key indexes are on the rise - the dow jones is at 23,436.05 , up 35.2 points or 0.2 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,582.04 , a rise of 21.6 points or 0.85 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 6,707.04 , up 150 points or 2.29 % .
on the dow jones , intel is top of the leaders , up 8 % with shares trading at $ 44.66 due to its profits jumping 34 % in the third quarter .

the cabot oil & gas corp is leading the s & p 500 up 8.6 % with shares trading at $ 26.77 due to better than expected sales , and on the nasdaq , struggling department store chain bon-ton stores is leading , up 38.4 % to trade at $ 1 , due to an amended credit arrangement to help it through the 2017 holiday season .

documents.title: more transparent ads
text: facebook has announced that it will make advertising on the social network more transparent and ask for documentation from advertisers , particularly for ads relating to politics and elections .
advertisers will also be required to add a `` paid for by `` disclosure line to all adverts relating to elections .

documents.title: no free trade with poorer countries call
text: no free trade with poorer countries call

documents.title: scots over 40 ' can not afford to retire '
text: nearly half of scots aged 40 to 64 believe they will not have enough money to retire when they reach state pension age , a survey has suggested .
yougov research for age scotland found 43 % said they would not be able to afford to give up work at that point .
a total of 44 % said they were planning to work into their late 60s and beyond to enjoy a better retirement lifestyle .
read more here

documents.title: uk cities bid for european culture title
text: uk cities bid for european culture title

documents.title: mixed feelings
text: with less than 18 months to go until we leave the european union , hundreds of midlands business leaders say it 's the continuing uncertainty that 's worrying them most .
sunday politics surveyed almost 700 local businesses across the west midlands - 26 % of them said brexit was having a negative impact , while only 11 % reported positive effects .
yes , nearly two-thirds , 63 % , reported a neutral impact .
there are increasing signs that this political uncertainty could drag on well beyond the government 's proposed two-year `` implentation period '' after brexit .
see more on sunday politics at 11:00 on bbc one on sunday .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: wells fargo under investigation
text: wells fargo is currently under investigation by us federal prosecutors over its foreign exchange trading .
wells fargo learned of an issue associated with a foreign exchange transaction for a single client , '' said a company 's spokeswoman .
`` the matter was reviewed , the client was promptly notified regarding the issue and wells fargo leadership took steps to hold accountable the individuals who were involved . ''
the investigation is being carried out by the us attorney 's office for the northern district of california , according to the wall street journal .

documents.title: not to do with trump
text: as reported earlier , us gdp beat forecasts to grow by 3 % in the third quarter .
president trump posted on twitter at 2pm bst that the `` prior eight years did n't come close to this '' , however harvard university 's professor kenneth rogoff disagrees .
u.s. gdp growing 3 % in q3 is a very good number '' but does n't have much to do with president trump - @ twitterid tells @ twitterid # economics
tackling slow pace of productivity growth will be key if trump wants to take credit for future economic growth .
its not where it used to be
i saw your interview this morning , aaron .
both you and mr. krogoff did a good job .
@ twitterid @ twitterid # aaronheslehurst # bbcworldnews
'bullshit ' it has everything to do with president trump , since trump becoming president the economy has exploded .
no , but when the taxes get cut our gdp will be 6 % and that will have alot to do with trump
you must also believe in flying pigs !
lol
author: World Business Report

documents.title: sterling sideways
text: sterling has continued to fall - the pound is now down by 0.4 % against the dollar to $ 1.3090 .
but it has risen by 0.3 % against the euro to €1.13190 .

documents.title: london stock markets end on a high
text: the ftse 100 index has closed up at 7,505.03 , which is 18.5 points or 0.3 % up , while the ftse 250 is down 17.3 points or 0.09 % to 20,146.06 .

the top winner on the ftse 100 is consumer goods manufacturer reckitt benckiser group , which was up 3.2 % with shares trading at £ 68.51 , while the top loser was ba owner international airlines group , down 6.8 % to trade at 625p , despite growing its profits and revenue in the third quarter .

on the ftse 250 , leading the winners was european investor polar capital technology trust , which rose 3.3 % to trade at £ 11.35 , while swiss iron ore firm ferrexpo led the losers by falling 4.8 % to trade at 256p .

documents.title: richie rich
text: amazon cofounder and chief executive jeff bezos is the richest person in the world , for the second time in a row .
amazon shares opened more than 8 % higher on friday , which added almost $ 7bn ( £ 5.3bn ) to mr bezos ' net worth .
but then the shares climbed another 2 % , adding another $ 900m in value to his net worth , so he now has a total net worth of $ 90.1bn , putting him ahead of microsoft cofounder bill gates .

documents.title: lufthansa expands flights
text: lufthansa has announced that it has expanded flights between glasgow and germany .
the airline will fly from glasgow to munich four times a week during winter , and five times a week including saturdays from march 2018 .
also in march 2018 , lufthansa will introduce a new daily flight from glasgow to frankfurt .

documents.title: brent crude trades above $ 60
text: oil prices have breached $ 60 per barrel for the first time since the july 2016 .
north sea brent crude is up 72 cents to $ 60.02 cents a barrel .
the latest gains come after saudi arabia and russia indicated their support for extending a deal to curb oil output for another nine months .

documents.title: what 's going on with the gender pay gap ?
text: the gender pay gap for full-time employees is 9.1 % , which is its lowest since records began in 1997 , according to the annual survey of hours and earnings , which was released by the ons yesterday .
but there is an interesting divergence within that .
the gap for full-time employees in the private sector decreased from 16.7 % last year to 15.9 % this year , which is also the lowest since 1997 .
but the pay gap in the public sector grew from 11.1 % to 13.1 % , which is still a considerably smaller gap than the private sector , but the biggest gap we 've seen in the public sector since 1999 .

and if you 're wondering how the public and private sector averages can both be higher than the overall average , it 's because it 's a median figure - that 's when you put all the salaries in order and take the middle one .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: paul newman 's watch sells for a fortune
text: american movie legend paul newman 's rolex has sold for a record $ 17.8m ( £ 13.6m ) , making it the most expensive wristwatch ever to be sold in an auction .
mr newman died in 1998 of cancer at the age of 83 .
the watch was given to him by his wife joanna woodward and engraved with the words `` drive carefully me '' .

after wearing it for over a decade , mr newman gave the watch to his daughter 's college boyfriend james cox , who decided to auction off the watch and give the proceeds to the nell newman foundation , according to the new york times .

documents.title: winners and losers
text: the tech-heavy nasdaq has risen to a record high due to strong earnings reports from amazon , microsoft , intel , and google parent alphabet .
google won huge revenues from online ads , amazon boosted sales from its fresh acquisition of grocery chain whole foods and microsoft was strengthened by gains in cloud computing .

as for the losers , apart from retailers and toy makers mentioned in our post earlier , pharmaceutical firm merck fell 4 % , while energy corporation chevron dropped 3.6 % , both due to disappointing earnings results .

documents.title: spanish shares sink
text: madrid 's stock market has sunk on the news that catalonia 's parliament voted to declare independence from spain .
madrid 's benchmark ibex 35 index of major companies was showing a loss of more than one percent in value in late afternoon deals .
`` the ibex 35 is the notable exception to europe 's positive move , as the market is in the red , '' said ig analyst david madden .
`` the spanish senate is expected to vote in favour of stripping catalonia of its autonomous powers and impose direct rule from madrid .
such a move is likely to stir up tensions in the region , and investors are staying clear of spanish stocks . ''

documents.title: us market tracks sideways
text: two of the three key us stock indexes rose on friday , while one fell , due to disappointing profit and sales forecasts from us department stores jc penney , macy 's and kohl 's , as well as trouble for toy maker mattel .
the dow jones is at 23,368.98 , down 31.9 points or 0.14 % .
the s & p 500 is at 2,567.18 , a rise of 6.7 points or 0.26 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is at 6,635.43 , a rise of 78.66 points or 1.20 % .

documents.title: ireland says brexit talks ca n't move on without border clarity
text: britain 's brexit talks ca n't progress to trade relations until it gives more clarity on what will happen at its border with ireland , irish foreign minister simon coveney has said .

the border with northern ireland , which will be the uk 's only land frontier with the eu after its departure , is one of three issues brussels wants broadly solved before talks on trade can start in december at the earliest .
`` on the border issue , i 'm sorry but we need more clarity than we have right now .
we can not move ahead to phase two on the back of a promise that we do n't see any delivery mechanism to make a reality , '' mr coveney said .

`` we do n't need all the answers but we certainly need to have more assurance than we have today and we need some understanding that if the trade negotiations collapse , which could happen , that the irish issues will still be resolved and prioritised . ''

documents.title: sterling still falling
text: sterling is still falling - the pound is down by 0.6 % against the dollar to $ 1.30820 .
the pound is flat against the euro , down 0.1 % at €1.12770 .

documents.title: uk 'wants to leave cap in march 2019 '
text: uk 'wants to leave cap in march 2019 '

documents.title: sturgeon seeks brexit transition clarity
text: scotland 's first minister writes to theresa may seeking `` urgent clarity '' for transition arrangement after brexit .

documents.title: us growth rate hits 3 %
text: the us economy unexpectedly maintained a brisk pace of growth in the third quarter as an increase in inventory investment and a smaller trade deficit offset a hurricane-related slowdown in consumer spending and a decline in construction .
gross domestic product increased at a 3 % annual rate in the july-september period after expanding at a 3.1 % pace in the second quarter , the commerce department said on friday .

the department said that while it was impossible to estimate the overall impact of hurricanes harvey and irma on third-quarter gdp , preliminary estimates showed that the back-to-back storms had caused losses of $ 121bn in privately owned fixed assets and $ 10.4bn in government-owned fixed assets .

documents.title: jc penney shares crash
text: jc penney shares plunged 24 % after the us store chain slashed its 2017 profit and comparable sales forecasts as it sold stagnant inventory at heavy discounts ahead of a holiday-season refresh .

penney , like macy 's and kohl 's , has been struggling with declining demand for apparel , the mainstay of department stores , due to tough competition from off-price retailers as well as amazon.com .
penney 's response has been to lower its dependence on clothing by expanding in other categories such as toys and white goods .
macy 's dropped 5.5 % and kohl 's nearly 3 % .

documents.title: hurricane harvey 'cuts into exxonmobil earnings '
text: just in : exxonmobil says hurricane harvey cut earnings by $ 160 million , or 4 cents a share .
$ xom

documents.title: merck blames cyber attack for sales drop
text: drugs giant merck says sales were reduced by $ 240m in the third quarter after a cyber-attack which halted production in june .
it said revenue also took a £ 135m hit due to the cyber-attack .

documents.title: breakingjigsaw searching for buyer
text: the controlling shareholder in jigsaw , the fashion retailer , is looking to sell a part or whole of the business .

documents.title: harvey weinstein sues former company over personal records
text: harvey weinstein sues former company over personal records

documents.title: rbs 'bracing for a big fine '
text: rbs is in the black for a third consecutive quarter .
it reported £ 392m third quarter profits reported , taking profits so far this year to £ 1.331bn .

rbs expects to be profitable in 2018 , and given that it is profitable so far in 2017 , this suggests it is expecting a fine from the us department of justice to hit in the fourth quarter of this year , says laith khalaf , a senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
`` rbs faces the indignity of suffering a tenth year without a profit , though this really all depends on the timing and size of the fine that 's coming from the us department of justice .
`` the fact the bank has said it expects to be profitable next year suggests rbs is bracing for a pretty imminent rap on the knuckles .
`` the large and unpredictable nature of this liability looms large over rbs , and could hamper its ability to pass the bank of england 's 2017 stress test , '' he says .

documents.title: sir hector sants 'agrees to give hbos evidence in public '
text: sir hector sants , who was chief executive of the financial services authority , has agreed to give evidence in public at the high court about the rescue of hbos by lloyds bank , the ft reports .
sir hector had previously applied to give evidence in private .

documents.title: oil nears $ 60 a barrel
text: brent crude prices are trading just under $ 60 a barrel , after remarks by saudi arabia 's crown prince mohammad bin salman that he could support extending cuts implemented by opec and other major oil producing nations such as russia .
brent crude is down 0.3 % at $ 59.12 a barrel .

jeffrey halley , senior analyst at oanda , says : `` oil raced higher overnight with brent finishing in sight of the magical $ 60 a barrel mark , spurred on by saudi remarks supporting the oil production cut through to the end of 2018 . ''
west texas intermediate is also down 0.3 % at $ 52.51 .
opec is expected to discuss extending the agreement at a meeting in vienna on 30 november .

documents.title: lack of competition in online hotel booking , says bha
text: the british hospitality association welcomes the cma probe into whether travel websites serve consumers well .

chief executive ufi ibrahim says : `` many of our members have been concerned about the vast power of online booking agencies often charging high rates of commission , use of misleading information , pressure selling , and a lack of transparency .
in the process , guests are paying more than they should for rooms . ''
the bha says it is also concerned that the online booking industry is dominated by only two companies who own 80 % of the european market .
expedia owns hotels.com , trivago and travelocity while priceline group owns booking , com , kayak and agoga .
it says : `` this means that this is difficult for others to break into the market '' .

documents.title: hsbc outage 'caused by technical hitch '
text: hsbc 's online and mobile banking outage this morning was `` caused by a technical issue with a scheduled upgrade to our personal internet banking service , which did not complete properly , '' hsbc says .
`` services were impacted for several hours and customers were directed to our contact centres for urgent banking requirements .
the problem was fixed at around 9.30am , '' it added .

documents.title: sterling dips on dollar and euro
text: sterling has fallen after enjoying a rise earlier this week when better than expected uk gdp figures for the third quarter raised the likelihood of an interest rate rise in november .
the pound declined by 0.44 % on the dollar to $ 1.31030 on friday .
it is trading 0.27 % down on the euro at €1.12580 .

documents.title: palmer and harvey in exclusive deal talks
text: wholesaler palmer and harvey has announced that it is in exclusive talks with private equity firm the carlyle group .
it says that a potential deal `` remains subject to ongoing due diligence '' .
discussions about palmer and harvey 's future emerged in september as it emerged that the company was struggling with debts .

documents.title: trebles all round
text: with news that competition authorities are to probe hotel bookings websites to see if consumers are being misled , simon calder , travel editor of the independent , says it may be possible to wrangle a free drink if you go directly to the source :
`` not every traveller is fully aware of the commission levels that many of these hotel booking websites apply .
the starting rate is 15 % , which means that £ 15 out of every £ 100 stay is being taken by the intermediary .
`` hotels sometimes pay even more commission for increased 'visibility ' - i.e .
giving the booking site even more in return for a higher profile on search returns .

`` i look at these websites to get an idea of price levels , but then i will contact my preferred property direct and see if they will match the online rate - and perhaps provide a bonus such as a welcome drink or a free breakfast into the bargain . ''

documents.title: 'unlikely ' ubs will move 1,000 jobs overseas post-brexit
text: the chief executive of ubs says that it is looking `` more and more unlikely '' that it will move 1,000 london jobs to europe following brexit .

the financial times reports that sergio ermotti said on friday that the swiss private bank has received `` regulatory and political clarifications '' that make it unlikely that it will have to trigger the worst case scenario of shifting 1,000 posts overseas .
he said : our target is to keep as many people as we we can in london . ''

documents.title: eu bank to owe uk billions 'for decades '
text: eu bank to owe uk billions 'for decades '

documents.title: trivago responds to cma investigation
text: price comparison site trivago says it is `` aware of the announcement by the uk competition and markets authority that it will review the hotelbooking sector in the uk to better understand how the sector works '' .
it says : `` the cma said that it has written to companies across the sector asking for relevant information .
trivago will work with the cma to explain the benefits it delivers to consumers looking for their ideal hotel . ''

documents.title: uber names banking veteran as uk chair
text: laurel powers-freeling has been appointed as non-executive chair of uber 's uk business .
ms powers-freeling is the former chief executive of m & s money and in the past has worked as an adviser at the bank of england .
last month , transport for london decided not to renew uber 's licence to operate in london on the grounds of `` public safety and security implications '' .
the ride-hailing app announced in october that its london-based head of northern europe affairs , jo bertram , was leaving the firm .
uber said her departure was not connected with recent events .

documents.title: iag shares drop after revenue growth per seat dips
text: shares in british airways owner iag are down more than 4 % after it said revenue growth per available seat was slightly behind the previous quarter .
but on the year its shares are up more than 55 % .
hargreaves lansdown analyst george salmon says :
`` the whole sector is getting a boost from cheap fuel prices , but for those at the budget end much of that is being cancelled out by extra competition .
indeed monarch , alitalia and air berlin have already succumbed to the pressure .
`` however , the ba and iberia operator is not too concerned with the dogfight below them .
rather than being forced into slashing fares , iag has been able to hold pricing up so far this year , meaning the shares have been soaring . ''

documents.title: and we 're back in the room
text: hsbc says its banking and mobile services have been restored after an outage :
a spokesperson for hsbc said : our online and mobile banking services are now available .
we are sorry for any inconvenience caused . ''
ok then .

documents.title: us-swiss chemical giants call off $ 20bn merger
text: us chemicals group huntsman and its swiss counterpart clariant have abandoned a planned $ 20bn merger after activist shareholders campaigned against the deal .

white tale had increased its shareholding clariant to more than 20 % and , with other opposition to the merger , raised the prospect that the two companies might not gain enough investor support for the deal .
peter huntsman and hariolf kottmann , chief executives of huntsman and clariant respectively , said they still believed the tie-up `` would have been in the long-term best interests '' of investors .

they said : `` however , given the continued accumulation of clariant shares by activist investor white tale holdings and its opposition to the transaction , which is now supported by some other shareholders , we believe that there is simply too much uncertainty as to whether clariant will be able to secure the two-thirds shareholder approval that is required to approve the transaction under swiss law . ''

documents.title: the ties that bind
text: if the uk and the european investment bank will still be tied together for years to come , why is it currently delaying investment in british projects ?

vice president alexander stubbs says : `` first of all the uk owns 16 % of the bank and last year , for instance , we provided loans and financial instruments to the uk to the better part of €8bn . ''

he says that the reason why `` this will be lowered this year and next year '' is because of the uncertainty surrounding brexit and the guarantees that the bank requires to `` make sure we are getting our money back , that the investments are safe and sound '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: what is the european investment bank ?
text: the european investment bank ( eib ) is owned by and represents the interests of the eu members states .
last year , it invested around £ 6bn in the uk for projects such as the northern powerhouse .

asked whether all investments between the bank and the uk will be severed because of brexit , the eib 's vice president alexander stubb tells the bbc 's today programme it will `` obviously have an impact '' because the uk will no longer be a major shareholder in the bank .
`` but you much remember that we 're a bank that provides for financial instruments very long periods so this basically means that the uk will be married to the eib at least up until 2054 . ''
however , he claims that the eib is not getting as many requests at the moment .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: hsbc online banking problems 'not ideal '
text: business live page reader patrick meehan says ( with admirable understatement ) :
`` hsbc website , online banking app , all unobtainable .
not an ideal situation , is it ? ''

documents.title: bittersweet end for stock market traders
text: end of an era for hong kong trading floor

documents.title: japan 's nikkei hits fresh 21-year high
text: japan 's benchmark stock index has had its best close since mid-1996 .
the nikkei rose 1.2 % , or 268 points , to 22,008.54 points .
markets in asia have been surging to historic or multi-year highs , thanks to strong corporate profits and record runs on wall street .
elsewhere in the region , south korea 's kospi and hong kong 's hang seng advanced in morning trade , while australia 's s & p/asx 200 index closed down 0.2 % .

documents.title: vw third quarter profits halve
text: volkswagen third quarter profits dropped by 52.2 % to €1.6bn after charges of €2.6bn connected with its diesel scandal .

documents.title: 'no winners in brexit ' says european investment bank vp
text: alexander stubb vice president of the european investment bank says brexit one of biggest travesties in modern era @ twitterid

documents.title: london stock markets rise
text: the ftse 100 has opened 12.57 points higher at 7,499.07 .
rbs 's share price has risen 1.85 % to 286.2p in the first minutes of trading after it published its third quarter results .
conversely , iag , which owns british airways , saw its shares tumble by 3.13 % to 649p on its figures for the july to september period .
carillion investors welcomed the appointment as andrew davies as its new chief executive .
shares rose 2.82 % to 45.5p .
the ftse 250 is ahead 6.26 points at 20,169.64 .

documents.title: uk 'gloomy about house price prospects '
text: people seem to be pretty pessimistic about the outlook for house prices , according to halifax bank .

`` housing market optimism has declined significantly over the past year , with almost half of people expecting a general slowdown in the market , '' said russell galley , managing director of halifax community bank .
confidence had dropped to its lowest for nearly five years due to pessimism about the economy rather than the prospect of higher interest rates , the halifax survey suggested .
annual house price growth was 5 % in august compared with about 8 % just before last year 's brexit vote .

documents.title: 'six people are looking at this room ' - says who ?
text: the cma 's nisha arora says that these hotel booking sites can be `` brilliant '' at finding the best deals for people .
`` but in order for them to find the best deal , in order for them to find the best price the information has to be clear , it has to be accurate , '' she says .
`` if consumers are being steered away- steered towards certain deals that might not be the best price for them , that might not be the best deal - they might well lose out . ''

ms arora says that the way in which hotel booking sites steer people is by stating that `` six other people '' are looking at the same place a consumer is interested in , or that a room has been `` booked three hours ago '' .
`` we 're not sure of the basis of those claims , `` she says .
`` on what basis are those claims being made ?
we are requiring companies to give us information about the basis for their practices .

`` we also want to hear from consumers about their experiences so we 've opened up a survey today asking them for their experiences and all of the information will help us get to the bottom of this , to understand what is going on , whether consumers are being misled and whether sites are breaking consumer law . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: footasylum to float on aim
text: uk-based shoe and fashion retailer footasylum says it will float on the alternative investment market ( aim ) on 2 november .
it expects to raise £ 65.4m from institutional and other investors .

documents.title: consumers 'may not be getting the best deal '
text: nisha arora , senior director at the competition and markets authority ( cma ) tells the bbc 's today programme that the watchdog is investigating online booking sites because it is `` concerned about the clarity , the accuracy and the presentation of information that these sites are giving consumers '' .
she says : `` we 're worried that rather than helping consumers choose , they actually might be making it more difficult for people to find and choose the best deal for them . ''

in particular , she says that the recommendations that people receive once they have done a search `` are influenced not only by the consumer 's search criteria but by commercial factors such as commission which the consumer is n't really concerned about '' .
she says : `` it is not made clear to consumers that this is the case .
they might well those recommended sites , thinking that it is the best deal for them when it might in fact it might not be . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: short on time ? camp on the office roof
text: elon musk is the boss of electric-car maker tesla .
he has also built a giant factory to build batteries in the nevada desert , called the gigafactory .
btw , just want to express a word of appreciation for the hard work of the tesla gigafactory team .

documents.title: carillion names news boss
text: troubled infrastructure and construction firm carillion has named andrew davies as its new chief executive .
he will take over from interim boss keith cochrane in april .
in july , carillion shares plunged following a sales warning .

documents.title: all in the language
text: james bevan , chief investment officer of ccla , notes the language used on thursday by european central bank president mario draghi when he announced that he will halve its €60bn monthly bond-buying programme .

`` very interestingly , he talked about downsizing rather than tapering , and therefore what he has said is he 's going to spend less money each month , but he 's definitely going to carry on spending , and that he also identified that if he needs to he could spend even more money . ''

mr bevan adds : `` i think there are a lot of people who are relatively relieved because if one looks at the mathematics of european growth , a lot of it has come because the european central bank has been providing lending and therefore the quality of this growth is not particularly very high and that growth may not be self-sustained . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: iag passenger and cargo revenues grow
text: iag , which owns ba , iberia and vueling , says that third quarter passenger revenue rose by 1.6 % to €5.8bn between july and september while cargo grew by 7.9 % to €240m .
chief executive willie walsh says : `` our commercial performance was good despite underlying disruption from severe weather and terrorism .
`` iag cargo improved in the quarter due to stronger asia pacific demand compared to last year . ''

documents.title: rbs cuts costs
text: rbs says it has taken out £ 708m in costs in terms of job losses , withdrawing from certain territories , and stripping down the business so far this year .
the bank made a £ 392m attributable profit in the third quarter .

rbs was rescued in a record £ 45.5bn bailout at the height of the 2008 financial crisis , and has not made an annual profit since 2007 , although it has been in the black every quarter so far in 2017 .

documents.title: breakingba-owner profits soar
text: international consolidated airlines group says revenue rose by 2 % to €6.6bn in the third quarter , while pre-tax profit grew by 22.5 % to €1.2bn .

documents.title: breakingrbs profits rise in the third quarter
text: rbs made a statutory profit of £ 392m in the third quarter compared with a £ 469m loss last year , it reports .

documents.title: hotel booking sites to be investigated
text: britain 's competition watchdog is to investigate hotel booking sites to see if consumers are being mislead over the best deals .
the competition and markets authority ( cma ) said it was `` concerned about the clarity , accuracy and presentation of information on sites '' .
the investigation will examine areas such as hidden charges , search results , and discount claims .
evidence is being sought from websites , hotels and consumers , the cma said .
read more here .

documents.title: us growth 'may be closer to 4 % '
text: ms o'carroll cautions against reading too much into friday 's us gdp figures , because it 's only the first reading of economic growth , and is based on partial data .
she says that economists prefer to use nowcasting figures and , based on that , us economic growth is closer to donald trump 's target of 4 % growth .
she says that `` a little '' can be attributed to the us president in terms of `` enthusiasm and euphoria '' .
`` but he is yet to deliver on a lot of the promises he has made , and as i said earlier , a lot of this momentum is global and predates trump coming to power .
`` he may wish to claim it but i do n't think it is solely down to him , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: smashing pumpkins
text: uk consumers are expected to spend more than £ 320m on halloween this year , that 's 3.2 % higher than last year - so people are still due to spend more despite the squeeze on wages .
gemma thompson , co-owner of pick your own pumpkin in ashford , kent , says her business is `` hugely successful '' .
`` we started about four years ago , just because we had some surplus stock , and we thought we 'd open up our fields to the public .
ever since then it 's become an even more popular activity . ''
for your own , she grows around 70,000 pumpkins , and for supermarkets they supply just over one million .
pick your own customers are `` especially after the larger size of pumpkin , which a lot of the supermarkets do n't offer . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: no change for america 's have and have-nots
text: later on friday , the us will release its first reading of economic growth for the third quarter .
it is expected to reach a creditable 2.5 % .
however , that falls short of president donald trump 's hope of expansion at around 3-4 % .
lucy o'carroll , chief economist at aberdeen standard investments , tells the bbc 's today programme : `` america is being swept up in the global growth story .
`` we saw improvement and a up in the data well before donald trump came to power .
if you look at the data globally it has been pretty impressive in the second half of last year . ''
however she doubts that growth is being spread equally between america 's rust-belt and the more affluent coastal states .
`` they have for a signifciant period of time now lagged the headline figure so i imagine that has been continuing in the third quarter . ''
she also points out that the third quarter covers the july to september period , so will show the impact of the hurricanes on the us economy .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ubs profits grow but miss forecasts
text: switzerland 's ubs , the world 's largest private bank , has reported a 14 % rise in third quarter profit to 946m swiss francs ( £ 721.5m ) .
despite the rise , income fell short of analysts ' expectations of 1.04bn swiss francs .
however , it was ahead of ubs 's own forecast of 897m swiss francs .

documents.title: amazon at risk ?
text: amazon could be at risk of being slapped with an antitrust writ by the trump administration , which could say `` look guys , you 're not actually trying to run a business on capitalist lines , you 're simply trying to kill competition , we think that 's unacceptable , '' says james bevan of ccla .
`` if that were to happen , then the market would take that extremely badly , '' he says .
amazon is `` delivering on the share price front , so you wo n't get a fat dividend for sure , '' he adds , `` but if you have been holding amazon shares you have made a bundle . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: tech companies 'getting more powerful '
text: we had a clutch of tech giant results last night .
google parent alphabet , amazon , microsoft , twitter and intel all reported .
`` they are all doing extremely well , that 's the main takeaway from all of this , '' says bbc north america tech reporter dave lee .
`` tech companies they 're just getting more and more powerful . ''
alphabet 's profits rose by 33 % compared with last year , `` an enormous amount , and that because people are clicking more often on their advertising , '' says dave .
amazon revenues increased by 34 % , helped by the whole foods acquisition .
twitter has famously made a profit , but in the next three months it may have made a profit , dave adds .

documents.title: good morning
text: coming up we have third quarter results from rbs and airline group iag .
rbs returned to profit in the first-half of the year , despite a big one-off charge due to a us legal case .
it made a profit of £ 939m , a big turnaround from the £ 2bn loss in the same period of 2016 .
the bank had legal costs of £ 396m , largely related to a settlement over mis-sold us mortgage products .
the bank has also come under ongoing fire for its treatment of uk small business customers by its global restructuring group , which operated between 2005 and 2013 .
on thursday it also settled a us criminal investigation that accused its traders of lying to clients over investments between 2008 and 2013 .

we 'll find out how british airways owner iag is doing compared with other airlines - ryanair 's mass flight cancellations , alitalia and air berlin entering administration , and monarch airlines ' collapse earlier this month .
